assignments.utilization_method: Stand the notebook on its bottom short edge like a small wall. A strike on the top initially feels firm; the lightweight book instantly folds flat or falls, removing contact force and producing the desired sudden give.

physical_object.name: white and grey digital camo wireless game controller

assignments.utilization_method: Rest the controller on its back so its triggers point upward; swing the chair so the underside of the seat collides with the plastic shell. The hard ABS shell yields a solid knock, then the controller skids away across the floor, giving a clean break-away sensation that reads as the log splitting.

physical_object.name: black stainless steel Tesla-branded water bottle

assignments.utilization_method: Pinch the narrow neck just below the cap with your thumb on one side and two fingers on the other. The bottle’s tall metal body projects forward, giving you a nose-heavy feeling very similar to a filled mug hanging from a slim handle. Lift and tilt the bottle exactly as you would tilt the virtual mug toward your mouth.

Grasp the roll about one-third from the bottom so the longer section extends outward, imitating a blunt axe. Although mass is low, the length and cylinder encourage a full-hand grip and shoulder-swing trajectory resembling an axe handle.

physical_object.name: black and silver telescoping selfie stick with phone holder

assignments.utilization_method: Collapse one or two segments so the foam grip becomes the handle and keep the phone clamp closed to form a compact, heavier tip. The stick’s length, cylindrical grip, and noticeable weight at the clamp end give an excellent head-heavy hammer sensation when swung.

Partially close your fist around the top half so that the bulk of the weight hangs below the palm. The dense feel supplies pronounced inertia; quick wrist pivots imitate the momentum of the sickle’s iron blade despite the missing curve.
